remarks: The size of the set of closed walks of length n is divisible by n.  This corresponds to statement 9 in [Huneke] p. 2:  "It follows that, if p is a prime number, then the number of closed walks of length p is divisible by p".  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 6-Jul-2018.)
statement:
clwlkndivn $p |- ( ( V USGrph E /\ V e. Fin /\ N e. Prime ) -> N || ( # ` { c e. ( V ClWalks E ) | ( # ` ( 1st ` c ) ) = N } ) ) $.
$d E c $.
$d N c $.
$d V c $.
